casebody.data:
Michael J. BYRNES, Libelant-Appellee, v. CORNELL STEAMBOAT COMPANY, Respondent-Appellant, and Steamer Trojan, Her Engines, etc.; Middleton S. Borland, as Receiver of Hudson Navigation Company, Claimant-Appellee. Circuit Court of Appeals, Second Circuit. December 19, 1927. No. 76. Kirlin, Woolsey, Campbell, Iiickox & Keating, of New York City (Robert S. Erskine and Henry P. Elliott, both of New York City, of counsel), for appellant. Park, Mattison & Lynch, of New York City (Anthony V. Lynch, Jr., of Now York City, of counsel), for appellee Byrnes. Reynolds, Richards & MeCutcheon, of New York City (John S. Chapman, of New York City, of counsel), for claimant-appellee.

Before MANTON, L. HAND, and SWAN, Circuit Judges.

PER CURIAM.

Decree affirmed, with eosts.
